intro: Clompanus molucanus, commonly known as the Moluccan clompanus, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
